climbs.name: Wrenched
climbs.fa: Brad Singer, Eric Odenthal & John Cardmon, May 2005

content.description: Climb the plated face past a sloping ledge down low to more continuous face above to finish on a large ledge with anchors up and right.
content.protection:
1 bolt for directional

Used to sport 4 bolts and anchors
content.location: Left side of the north face.

climbs.name: Tri-Tip and Corn
climbs.fa: Pat Brennan and Mark Goldsmith, August 1999

content.description:
Climb the plated crack two-thirds of the way then break left and follow the arete.

Originally led on gear but later retro bolted; this route shares the same bolts and anchors as

Cornbread

.
content.location: Center of the colorful west face.

climbs.name: Dreamweaver
climbs.fa: Bob Cable, Art Bertolina, Julia Cronk, Jim Velie, E. Odenthal, Kenn Kenaga (6-00)

content.description: Crux is handcrack before the arete.
content.location: Starts in crack on far right of tallest formation.  Continues up right side of arete and finishes at high point.

climbs.name: Cornbread
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga, Eric Tipton, Steve Gooden & Matt Reisling, August 1999

content.description:
A crack that climbs like a face climb (like much of Big Bear).

Originally led on gear but later retro bolted; this route shares the same bolts and anchors as

Tri-Tip and Corn

.
content.location: Goes straight up to the tallest point.  Rap down the chains.
